thread.title: Meeting to discuss future of circus in Hampshire
thread.title_full: Meeting to discuss future of circus in Hampshire

title: Meeting to discuss future of circus in Hampshire
text:
0 comments 
CIRCUS performers are being given the chance to come together at The Point to discuss where the future of the art lies. 
The Eastleigh venue is hosting the National Centre for Circus Arts for an Open Day aimed at circus artists from across the region. 
Since their relaunch in March 2014, the National Centre for Circus Arts has been working to raise the profile of circus; speaking with key decision makers, stakeholders, funders and politicians, to explain some of the challenges circus artists and circus companies face. 
And the centre is keen to find out what is happening in circus in Eastleigh and the wider area. Share article 
The open day on November 19 is free but places must be booked in advance by emailing sacha.lee@eastleigh.gov.uk. 
Delegates will also be able to buy discounted tickets for to see Flown by Pirates of the Carabina (pictured) on the same evening.
